[Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_comment-text) congratulations ! Impressive to see Copilot expanding into real time, multiperson collaboration. Earlier this year, I shared with your team a vision along these same lines .,how AI could evolve from assistance to simulation, helping professionals rehearse critical moments before they happen. It’s inspiring to watch that evolution taking shape. Collaboration is the foundation; simulation will be the next layer that truly transforms preparation and decision-making.

- [Report this comment](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_withgroups-copilot-goes-multiplayer-you-activity-7387173395374825472-QpyC&trk=public_post_comment_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=COMMENT&_f=guest-reporting)

[Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_comment-text) This is a game-changer — AI collaboration is finally evolving from solo to social.

The future of productivity won’t be you vs AI, it’ll be teams + AI in flow. Imagine product teams co-creating launch plans, students ideating together, or writers refining tone — all with Copilot acting as the silent “fifth teammate.”

Notion’s early success came from making knowledge collaborative. [Microsoft](https://www.linkedin.com/company/microsoft?trk=public_post_comment-text) just applied that same principle to intelligence. This shift turns [Microsoft Copilot](https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/microsoftcopilot/?trk=public_post_comment-text) from a personal assistant into a collective intelligence system.

When using Groups, assign Copilot a clear “role” (e.g. researcher, summarizer, critic) instead of asking random questions. It’ll multiply team efficiency instead of just adding automation.

[Like](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_withgroups-copilot-goes-multiplayer-you-activity-7387173395374825472-QpyC&trk=public_post_comment_like)

I would prefer to see the issues with Enterprise Copilot addressed before adding too many new features. In particular, the ability to read and parse PDF files in the Microsoft 365 app is subpar. Enterprise Copilot clearly lags behind ChatGPT and Grok in performance.

Yesterday I was interacting with Gemini, and had just listened to the Acquired podcast on Alphabet where it was talking about how the killer feature for Google Docs' launch was simultaneous multi-user editing. I immediately thought about how cool it would be to have real-time, simultaneous multi-user AI chat. And today it exists. The world we live in is incredible!

Title: With Groups, Copilot goes multiplayer! You can now collaborate in real time with your team + Copilot to brainstorm, co-write, plan or study together. One of my favorite new features …
Author: stclarke
